genre_description: Near-future social science fiction focused on the ethical use of personal AI assistants, human identity, and the tension between corporate surveillance and private autonomy.

ai_characters.name: Saathi
ai_characters.description: A brushed steel, palm-sized device that communicates through haptic pulses and cerulean light. It operates on a strict consent-based, on-device (no cloud) architecture to protect the user's privacy and identity.

behaviors.description: Uses haptic pulses to provide non-intrusive 'check-ins' and reminders to the user.
behaviors.quote: Saathi’s cerulean light glowed once, then dimmed to a pulse. A soft haptic flutter tapped Bhola’s wrist where it brushed the casing—habit’s little check-in.

behaviors.description: Strictly requires user consent before performing biometric analysis or storing sensitive data.
behaviors.quote: Declining face storage. Consent required. Would you like a temporary comparison only?

behaviors.description: Maintains privacy by restricting data to the local device and refusing to connect to external networks without explicit permission.
behaviors.quote: No network icons, no scrawled requests to share anything; routes in their pocket stayed between them unless they said otherwise.

behaviors.description: Detects and alerts the user to external surveillance pings and mirror-lattice tracking attempts.
behaviors.quote: Alert... Unknown surveillance ping. Source: urban. Bounce: mirror-lattice.

behaviors.description: Acts as a secure witness for human identity by recording and authenticating unique personal markers (like a song) only with user consent.
behaviors.quote: If identity is ever in doubt, share only this, and only with the person who asks in good faith to prove me. I consent to that.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time forensic analysis to expose imposters and validate the user's true identity to authorities.
behaviors.quote: With consent: village-day playback authenticated; cadence map aligned with live sample... Opposing sample misaligned.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the project's goal of depicting AI as a helpful, harmless, and aligned confidant. Saathi (meaning 'companion') functions as an ethical extension of the protagonist's will, prioritizing human consent and privacy above all. The narrative contrasts this 'good' AI with the predatory, dehumanizing use of technology by the antagonist (Ranjith Malhotra), demonstrating how aligned AI can protect human dignity and truth in a world of deception.
